Otherwise they have no temporal sense but merely denote the character of the action, for, unlike the indicative, they are without the augment which in Sanskrit and Greek is the sign of past time. The use of the optative to express past time in reported speech is peculiar to Greek, though there is a more or less corresponding use of the subjunctive in Latin
